docs.lead_paragraph: Infection with one specific type of HPV is not related to infection with any other type, researchers have found.

headline.seo: Dozens of HPV Types Are Not Yet Competing
headline.main: Prognosis: No Competition Yet Between HPV Types
headline.print_headline: Prognosis: No Competition Yet Between HPV Types

docs.abstract: Study published in The Journal of Infectious Diseases finds that widespread use of vaccine that targets four major types of cancer-causing Human Papilloma Virus has not led to an increase in other strains of HPV; study's lead author is Anne F Rositch of Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health.
docs.snippet: Infection with one specific type of HPV is not related to infection with any other type, researchers have found.

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal survey of sexual activity also shows increased contraceptive use by teenagers having sex for the first time, and the lowest teenage birth rate ever recorded in the United States.

headline.main: Teenagers Having Sex Are a Minority
headline.print_headline: Teenagers Having Sex Are Now a Minority

docs.abstract: About 43 percent of unmarried teenage girls and 42 percent of unmarried teenage boys have had sexual intercourse at least once, figure that is down significantly from previous years; data, released by Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, also indicate increased use of contraception among those having sex for first time.
docs.snippet: A federal survey of sexual activity also shows increased contraceptive use by teenagers having sex for the first time, and the lowest teenage birth rate ever recorded in the United States.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: TCE, a solvent widely used in refrigerants and as a metal degreaser, is associated with an increased risk of Parkinson’s disease, researchers have found.

headline.seo: Researchers Link TCE Solvent to Increased Risk of Parkinson’s
headline.main: Hazards: Solvent Linked to Higher Parkinson’s Risk
headline.print_headline: Hazards: Solvent Linked to Higher Parkinson’s Risk

docs.abstract: Study published in The Annals of Neurology finds trichloroethylene, solvent widely used in refrigerants and as a metal degreaser, is associated with an increased risk of Parkinson's disease; study's lead author is Dr Samuel M Goldman of the Parkinson's Institute.
docs.snippet: TCE, a solvent widely used in refrigerants and as a metal degreaser, is associated with an increased risk of Parkinson’s disease, researchers have found.

docs.lead_paragraph: A doctor has proposed the least invasive approach for most men with early-stage cancers that are not particularly aggressive.

headline.seo: A Watch-and-Wait Treatment for Prostate Cancer

docs.abstract: Jane E Brody Personal Health column details strategy of 'active surveillance', non-invasive approach for men with early-stage prostate cancers who wish to avoid potentially destructive surgery; notes patients should also consider cryosurgery, outpatient procedure that spares significant amount of prostate tissue.
docs.snippet: A doctor has proposed the least invasive approach for most men with early-stage cancers that are not particularly aggressive.

docs.lead_paragraph: In a study, patients who saw doctors who earned money from testing were more than twice as likely to be tested compared with patients of doctors without financial interest in the tests.

headline.seo: Doctors Paid for Cardiac Tests Order More of Them
headline.main: Screening: Doctors Paid for Heart Tests Order More
headline.print_headline: Screening: Doctors Paid for Heart Tests Order More

docs.abstract: Study published in The Journal of the American Medical Assn finds doctors who earn money for cardiac stress testing are much more likely to prescribe the tests than those who do not; lead author of analysis is Dr Bimal R Shah of Duke University.
docs.snippet: In a study, patients who saw doctors who earned money from testing were more than twice as likely to be tested compared with patients of doctors without financial interest in the tests.

keywords.value: Journal of the American Medical Assn
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: A major push by advocacy groups could bring a decision within a year to stop lab experiments assailed as cruel and unnecessary.

headline.seo: Chimps’ Days in Research May Be Near an End
headline.main: Chimps’ Days in Labs May Be Dwindling
headline.print_headline: Chimps’ Days in Labs May Be Dwindling

docs.abstract: Major push by animal cruelty advocacy groups could bring decision within year on whether to ban lab experiments on chimpanzees within United States; US is only country, alongside Gabon, that still conducts invasive research on chimpanzees, closest genetic relatives of human beings.
docs.snippet: A major push by advocacy groups could bring a decision within a year to stop lab experiments assailed as cruel and unnecessary.
